column4: Breakingviews: Yahoo's Alibaba spinoff gives Mayer one more year
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - It may have been the easiest activist case ever made. Yahoo is to offload its $40 billion stake in Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba  to its shareholders. The latest uppity shareholder involved  Starboard Value  may try to take credit but it has been an obvious goal for years. Though Yahoo's much smaller core business will be left exposed  the spinoff timing gives Chief Executive Marissa Mayer another year to make her turnaround count.

column5: Jan 28 UnitedHealth Group Inc on Wednesday backed Gilead Sciences Inc's hepatitis C treatment Harvoni on its 2015 commercial drug coverage list over a new competitor  Viekira Pak from AbbVie Inc.

column4: Valero CEO says low oil prices encourage global fuel demand
column5: HOUSTON Valero Energy Corp  Chairman and Chief Executive Joe Gorder said on Wednesday low oil prices are encouraging continued global demand for refined products like motor fuels gasoline and diesel.

column4: Valero CEO says low oil prices encourage global fuel demand
column5: HOUSTON  Jan 28 Valero Energy Corp  Chairman and Chief Executive Joe Gorder said on Wednesday low oil prices are encouraging continued global demand for refined products like motor fuels gasoline and diesel.

column4: MOVES- JP Morgan Chase  Oppenheimer  Wells Fargo  Fortress Investment
column5: Jan 28 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Wednesday. To inform us of other job changes  email moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column4: MOVES-Wells Fargo appoints three division managers in Southern California
column5: Jan 28 Wells Fargo Commercial Banking  part of Wells Fargo & Co  named three division managers to lead its commercial banking operations across Southern California.

column4: Westpac sells operations in five Pacific islands  retains Fiji and PNG
column5: SYDNEY  Jan 29 Westpac Banking Corp said on Thursday it had agreed to sell its banking operations in five Pacific Island nations to the Bank of South Pacific Ltd (BSP) for A$125 million to concentrate on its largest markets in the region.

column4: Shake Shack now expects IPO to be priced higher at $17-$19/share
column5: Burger chain Shake Shack Inc now expects its initial public offering to be priced at $17-$19 per share  up from $14-$16 expected earlier  valuing the company at up to $674.5 million.

column4: Shake Shack now expects IPO to be priced higher at $17-$19 a share
column5: Burger chain Shake Shack Inc  now expects its initial public offering to be priced at $17-$19 per share  up from $14-$16 expected earlier  valuing the company at up to $674.5 million.

column4: UPDATE 1-Shake Shack now expects IPO to be priced higher at $17-$19/share
column5: Jan 28 Burger chain Shake Shack Inc now expects its initial public offering to be priced at $17-$19 per share  up from $14-$16 expected earlier  valuing the company at up to $674.5 million.

column4: Imperial mulls sale of nearly 500 Esso-branded gas stations
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Jan 28 Canada's No. 2 integrated oil producer and refiner Imperial Oil Ltd  said on Wednesday it is considering selling 475 company-owned Esso gas stations.
